Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 22nd overall pick, by St. Louis in 1969...
Traded from St. Louis to Cincinnati on 6/9/1969 (Going to STL: CF F. Robinson. Going to CIN: RF M. Easler, P D. Baney)...
Injured on 6/23/1969 with a Pinched Nerve Neck, out for 5 days...
Injured on 4/14/1970 with a Inflamed Anterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 6 weeks...
Injured on 8/16/1970 with a Bruised Foot, out for 4 days...
Injured on 5/1/1972 with a Stiff Knee, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/1/1975, off John E. Miller (PHI)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/22/1975, off Bob Moose (PIT)...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/30/1977, hitting .615 with 0 HR, 2 RBI...
